data.title: Best Place
data.text: Food is great, drinks are amazing, service is awesome. a lot of old timers that go there. relaxed and good enviroment

data.title: Cock-a-Doodle
data.text:
Great breakfast, with large tasty helpings!
I ordered the 2 eggs, potatoes, bacon 4strips!) and toast for $8.75.  I could barely finish it.  My friend ordered the 2 eggs, linguini sausage, home style potatoes, biscuits and gravy for $9.  The owner Pat is great, as well as everyone else.  Due to the crowd, we had too wait a bit, but well worth it.
There is eating in both the restaurant and cocktail area.  If you choose the cocktail area you get the happy hour price for bloody marys, mimosas, and champagne.

data.title: Home Cooking
data.text: I've been coming here since I was a little girl. It hasn't changed much (you can't smoke inside anymore-Yay!), but it is still one of our go to places. The prices are reasonable, the food is always good and hearty. I don't know how they make their dinner rolls, but they are so good. They have daily soups that are always yummy. You can eat in the more traditional restaurant, or go to the bar area that has tables and booths. We usually eat in the bar area. They have music playing and TVs on and you almost always run into someone you know. The owner of the restaurant comes table to table to introduce herself or say hello. It is a town favorite for breakfast too. It is nothing fancy, just good home style cooking.

data.title: Local hole in the wall
data.text:
Great breakfast and fabulous pomagrante mimosa's
I drove by this place a thousand times, but once I went in.... hooked.  You'll love it

data.title: Neighboorhood family restaurant
data.text: Very pleasant  family restaurant. Friendly staff and adequate choices for food and drink. Excellent weekday happy hour. Prime Rib on weekends. Bar area is good dining area.

data.title: You better be hungry...
data.text: We joined friends for breakfast after a Bridge tournament. This restaurant was recommended to us and it was a great choice. The menu is quite large and the portions are even larger.  All four of us were very satisfied with the taste and the amount of food that we received. The server made numerous changes to the menu for several of us and was a really good and courteous sport about it. The prices were more than fair and I was surprised at the overall value. We will go back there again...

data.title: Homestead food
data.text: This is a good place to go if you want home style food.  They have a really good selection to choose from, like pasta, seafood, hamburgers, pork and chicken. On Friday and Saturdays, the have prime rib, which is very good. There soups are homemade as well as the rolls. They also serve home style breakfasts in the a.m. The owners also own The Royal Cut in Ontario, on Grove.  I also recommended it. It is more upscale, with white linen tablecloths. It is a steakhouse.

data.title: Great Country Cooking
data.text: This was such a great find in Chino. The food is authentic country. I ordered fried steak and it was delicious. The place is almost like a landmark in Chino opened in the1950's where it was the center of Ranching business before they all moved to Central  California. It has a full bar. Open for breakfast, lunch and dinner.

data.title: wish i can go lower
data.text: Food was great but the service was horrible. Didn't get any refills (asked about 5 times), We were asked to move so someone else can sit there. When we got our order it was great just the waiters need to me retrained

owner_response.author: PAT C, Owner at Cock-A-Doodle, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for your recent visit to the Cock A Doodle.  Unfortunately you did not have a good experience, I apologize for the manner in which you were treated.    I hope you return,  I'd love to meet you,  Please ask for me if you should decide to come back again. 
Sincerely
Pat
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Can't go wrong here
data.text: My favorite is breakfast.  Always a special on the board with a great price.  Food is always cooked to order and tastes great.

data.title: Enrique A
data.text: My parents have been eating here since the 60's. We still have family dinners or breakfast and normally order the tri-tip steak, country fried steak, hamburger steak, bisquits and gravy, all the varieties of omelets, and blueberry pancakes. Those are just our favorites. If your in the mood to drink the bar has great drinks at great prices. This place is past a 10, great service and great food!

data.title: Hometown goodness
data.text: We have been eating at Cock-A-Doodle since 1987 when we moved to Chino.  It was recommended to us for breakfast, which is great.  But we have discovered some of the best home cooked meals besides breakfast.  We recommend the restaurant to friends on a regular basis.  It's not fancy, but the food is great and the staff is always friendly.

data.title: Old Skool...
data.text: Welcome back to 1957...  We go for breakfast a couple of times a year...  Very good breakfast, on S&S they have Eggs Benedict with perfectly poached eggs!  Lots of big omelet options and really good Bloody Mary's!  The dinning room is quaint, but I recommend going in the side door to the bar and eating breakfast there!  Service is always friendly and efficient!  I hear the Friday and Saturday specials are good as well...  I'm going back!

data.title: Local favorite
data.text: This is my favorite local restaurant.  It has been here in Chino for over 50 years.  The service is about as friendly as can be with many of the servers working there many years. The owner comes around often to check on you and your meal.  Their Prime Rib special on Friday and Saturday nights is fantastic. They also have other daily specials and special holiday specials. Tonight (St. Patrick's Day) I will have their Corned beef and cabbage dinner as I have been doing for the past several years and it is always delicious. They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner and a lounge area with great drink and appetizer deals every day.

data.title: Like family
data.text: A true family neighborhood place. Been around for a while, but has always had friendly, efficient  service and home style cooking. And going as often as we do, we're treated like family. I love the chicken teriyaki and my wife swears by the chicken fried steak.

data.title: Old and tired building.
data.text:
The food was okay and service was ... tired and not very friendly. The waitress looked like she was worn out and ready to go home, this was at lunch time. The decor looks 50 years old. Parking is behind the building and the entrance is through the bar unless you walk around to the front door. The bar is dark wood and dim lights. The portions were good, the food was average diner fare and prices were reasonable. 
This is a hold out from Old Chino days and seems to be popular with longtime residents. I had the feeling they liked regular customers rather than new faces.

data.title: A Friendly Place to Dine
data.text: My family has been eating at the Cock-a-Doodle for over 50 years. Great steaks, ample portions, and the staff are always friendly and courteous. Sure, the décor may be a little tired, but it gives the place character!

data.title: Homestyle Good Food!!!
data.text: I have been eating at this restaurant for FORTY years! You can be assured the food is always the same quality. It's a nice feeling with homestyle food. Love the potatoes that come with breakfast (which is served all day long). Owners are usually always nearby. You won't be disappointed if you want the homemade kind of food, you can't get at a chain.

data.title: Don't
data.text: Old, dark & nasty. Dirty too I might add. I'll never go back to this dump. I walked into the place and was met with cigarette smoke and dirty looks.

data.title: Where they know your name...
data.text: Like coming home, the staff has a warm greeting and is always glad to see you. Fun people watching the regulars. Good hardworking friendly staff; real good home-style cooking with comfort foods like panckaes and eggs, tasty sandwhiches, steak and chicken and burgers. The happy hour menu is a meal in itself. Always nice to come back.
